gravity
Interface ComponentFactory

All Known Subinterfaces:
LazyComponentFactory
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultComponentFactory, LazyComponentFactoryDecorator
public interface ComponentFactory

This is the factory that will produce components. A factory can only produce instances of one component.

Version:
$Id: ComponentFactory.html,v 1.1 2004-05-12 04:49:31 harishkswamy Exp $
Author:
Harish Krishnaswamy

Method Detail

registerComponentImplementation

public void registerComponentImplementation(java.lang.Class compClass,
                                            java.lang.Object[] compCtorArgs,
                                            java.util.Map compSetrArgs)
This method should be used to register an implementation for the component.

Parameters:
compClass - Component implementation class.
compCtorArgs - Component constructor arguments. This is simply an array of the constructor argument values that will be used in the order it is provided.
compSetrArgs - Component setter arguments. This is a map of the implementation property names and their values.

registerComponentRegistrationLocation

public void registerComponentRegistrationLocation(Location location)
This method may be used to register the location of the component registration. The sole purpose of this method is to provide an error message with precise location information in the event of an error.

getComponentInstance

public java.lang.Object getComponentInstance()
This method will return an instance (concrete or hollow) of the component registered with this factory. The component instance indentity is implementation dependent.

Only the following is true of the returned component instance:

  • The returned component instance will be of the registered component type.
  • Method invocations on the returned component instance will be completed successfully provided an implementation was registered prior to the method invocation.

    The advantage of using this method is that an instance of the component may be obtained even prior to registering an implementation for the component.

    • registerComponentRetrievalLocation

    public void registerComponentRetrievalLocation(Location location)
    This method may be used to register the location of the component retrieval. The sole purpose of this method is to provide an error message with precise location information in the event of an error.

    returnComponentInstance

    public void returnComponentInstance(java.lang.Object comp)
    This method should be used to return a component instance obtained via getComponentInstance(). This method is primarily used for returning pooled components.
